intro: Calyptranthes obscura, commonly known as the dark calyptranthes, is a small evergreen shrub native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes other well-known plants like eucalyptus and myrtle. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as mountain forests and is often found in understory layers of tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
